title: James Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of James with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 5 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the epistle of James?
questions.explanation: The book opens with James identifying himself as the author (James 1:1).

questions.question: According to James, how should we respond when we fall into divers temptations?
questions.explanation: James instructs believers to count it all joy when facing various trials (James 1:2).

questions.question: What does the trying of your faith worketh, according to James?
questions.explanation: The testing of faith produces patience (James 1:3).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting ______.'
questions.explanation: James 1:4 teaches that patience leads to perfection and wanting nothing.

questions.question: If any of you lack wisdom, what does James encourage you to do?
questions.explanation: James says to ask God who gives liberally without reproach (James 1:5).

questions.question: True or False: James says a double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
questions.explanation: James describes a double minded man as unstable (James 1:8).

questions.question: According to James, what happens to the rich man?
options: He will fade away in his ways
questions.correctAnswer: He will fade away in his ways
questions.explanation: James tells that the rich man fades away like the flower of the grass (James 1:11).

questions.question: Who is blessed according to James 1:12?
questions.explanation: James says that the man who endures temptation shall receive the crown of life (James 1:12).

questions.question: True or False: James says God tempts no man.
questions.explanation: James clarifies that God cannot be tempted with evil nor tempt anyone (James 1:13).

questions.question: What is the sequence that James describes about lust?
options: Lust brings joy, joy brings peace
Lust conceives, brings forth sin, and sin brings forth death
Lust leads to wisdom and life
questions.correctAnswer: Lust conceives, brings forth sin, and sin brings forth death
questions.explanation: James explains that when lust conceives, it brings forth sin; and sin, when finished, brings forth death (James 1:15).

questions.question: According to James, from where comes every good and perfect gift?
questions.explanation: James declares that every good gift comes from above, from the Father of lights (James 1:17).

questions.question: True or False: James instructs believers to be swift to speak and slow to hear.
questions.explanation: James instructs to be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to wrath (James 1:19).

questions.question: According to James, what does the wrath of man work?
questions.explanation: James teaches that the wrath of man does not work the righteousness of God (James 1:20).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of ______, and receive with meekness the engrafted word.'
questions.explanation: James urges to lay aside filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness to receive the word (James 1:21).

questions.question: What does James say about being a hearer and not a doer of the word?
options: He is like a man beholding his natural face in a glass
questions.correctAnswer: He is like a man beholding his natural face in a glass
questions.explanation: James compares a hearer not doing the word to a man who looks at himself in a mirror and forgets his appearance (James 1:23-24).

questions.question: True or False: Pure religion includes visiting the fatherless and widows in their affliction.
questions.explanation: James defines pure religion as caring for orphans and widows and keeping oneself unspotted (James 1:27).

questions.question: What does James warn against showing in the assembly of believers?
questions.explanation: James warns against showing partiality or favoritism (James 2:1).

questions.question: According to James, who has God chosen rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom?
questions.explanation: James says God has chosen the poor who are rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom (James 2:5).

questions.question: True or False: James teaches that faith without works is dead.
questions.explanation: James emphasizes that faith without accompanying works is dead (James 2:26).

questions.question: Which Old Testament figure does James use as an example of faith justified by works?
questions.explanation: James cites Abraham's offering of Isaac as justification by works (James 2:21-22).

questions.question: Who else besides Abraham does James mention as justified by works?
questions.explanation: James mentions Rahab receiving the messengers and sending them out another way (James 2:25).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'My brethren, be not many ______, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.'
questions.explanation: James warns that many teachers will receive stricter judgment (James 3:1).

questions.question: According to James, what small member can boast great things and is a world of iniquity?
questions.explanation: James describes the tongue as a small member boasting great things and a fire of iniquity (James 3:5-6).

questions.question: True or False: James says the tongue is easy to tame.
questions.explanation: James states that no man can tame the tongue; it is an unruly evil (James 3:8).

questions.question: What contradiction does James point out about the tongue's use?
options: It blesses God and curses men
questions.correctAnswer: It blesses God and curses men
questions.explanation: James notes that the same tongue blesses God and curses men made in God's likeness (James 3:9-10).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and ______?'
questions.explanation: James uses the analogy of a fountain sending forth sweet water and bitter (James 3:11).

questions.question: How does James describe wisdom that comes from above?
options: Pure, peaceable, gentle, easy to be intreated, full of mercy
questions.correctAnswer: Pure, peaceable, gentle, easy to be intreated, full of mercy
questions.explanation: James contrasts heavenly wisdom as pure and peaceable, without partiality (James 3:17).

questions.question: True or False: Wars and fightings among believers come from their lusts that war in their members.
questions.explanation: James explains conflicts arise from lusts within believers (James 4:1).

questions.question: Why do believers not receive when they ask, according to James?
options: Because they ask amiss to consume on their lusts
questions.correctAnswer: Because they ask amiss to consume on their lusts
questions.explanation: James says they ask with wrong motives to spend on their pleasures (James 4:3).

questions.question: Who does James say is the enemy of God?
questions.explanation: James calls friendship with the world enmity with God (James 4:4).

questions.question: True or False: God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble.
questions.explanation: James affirms that God resists pride and gives grace to the humble (James 4:6).

questions.question: What does James advise believers to do to the devil?
options: Resist him and he will flee
questions.correctAnswer: Resist him and he will flee
questions.explanation: James instructs to resist the devil so he will flee (James 4:7).

questions.question: According to James, what should we say about our future plans?
options: If the Lord will, we shall live and do this or that
We should boast about our plans
questions.correctAnswer: If the Lord will, we shall live and do this or that
questions.explanation: James teaches acknowledging God's will in plans (James 4:15).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get ______.'
questions.explanation: James warns against boastful plans to buy and sell and get gain (James 4:13).

questions.question: True or False: Rejoicing in boastings is considered good by James.
questions.explanation: James says all such rejoicing is evil (James 4:16).

questions.question: What is sin according to James 4:17?
options: Knowing to do good and not doing it
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing to do good and not doing it
questions.explanation: James states sin is failing to do good when one knows to do it (James 4:17).

questions.question: Who does James rebuke in Chapter 5 for their miseries to come?
questions.explanation: James tells the rich men to weep and howl for their coming miseries (James 5:1).

questions.question: True or False: James says the riches of the rich are incorruptible.
questions.explanation: James says their riches are corrupted and moth-eaten (James 5:2).

questions.question: According to James, what cries out against the rich men?
options: The hired laborers' wages kept back
questions.correctAnswer: The hired laborers' wages kept back
questions.explanation: James says the wages of laborers kept back cry out and enter the ears of the Lord (James 5:4).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long ______ for it.'
questions.explanation: James encourages patience like a farmer waiting for fruit (James 5:7).

questions.question: What example of patience does James give in chapter 5?
questions.explanation: James points to Job's patience as an example (James 5:11).

questions.question: True or False: James instructs believers to swear by heaven and earth freely.
questions.explanation: James commands not to swear by heaven, earth or other oaths but to let your yes be yes and no be no (James 5:12).

questions.question: What should one do if he is sick, according to James?
options: Call for the elders to pray and anoint with oil
questions.correctAnswer: Call for the elders to pray and anoint with oil
questions.explanation: James instructs the sick to call elders to pray and anoint in the name of the Lord (James 5:14).

questions.question: True or False: The prayer of faith shall save the sick and the Lord shall raise him up.
questions.explanation: James promises the prayer of faith will save the sick and raise him up (James 5:15).

questions.question: According to James, what should the elders do when praying for the sick?
options: Pray with faith and anoint with oil
questions.correctAnswer: Pray with faith and anoint with oil
questions.explanation: James commands elders to pray with faith and anoint the sick with oil (James 5:14).
